text.tryoutDoesNotResolve: Optional: Tryout does not resolve, try typing the date as you would in the metadata of a note
text.outputTryoutResult: The final date display base on your tokens and the above input values should resolve to: {formatedDate}

dateFormatCreationConfirmation.tokens: Here's a recap of all your tokens ordered from highest to lowest value
dateFormatCreationConfirmation.inputRegex: Here's the regex that will be used to parse your input date.
dateFormatCreationConfirmation.outputFormat: And last but not least, the template used to format the dates when displayed in a timeline card

text.outputTryoutDoesNotResolve: Your format does not resolves to anything

title.lookForInlineEventsInNotes: Look for events in note body

label.markdownBlockTagsToFindSeparator: Markdown Code Block "Tags To Find" Separator
label.lookForTagsForTimeline: Check to include a notes tags into the values used to assign notes to a timeline
label.lookForInlineEventsInNotes: Check to ennable the inline event feature. This allows to define events for any timeline from inside a note.
label.applyAdditonalConditionFormatting: Toggle on to allow date tokens conditional formatting to be allowed. When set to false this feature will be skipped. This could save you a few milliseconds off every card render.
label.stylizeDateInline: Turn on to align the date with the title in the timeline cards.
label.dateFontSize: Override the font size of the date in the timeline cards (value in pixels)
label.titleFontSize: Override the font size of the title in the timeline cards (value in pixels)
label.bodyFontSize: Override the font size of the body in the timeline cards (value in pixels)

description.dateDisplayFormat: This is the end format the date should be displayed as in the actual timeline cards. You don't actually need to include every parsed member here.
description.noteInlineEventKey: Used to detect inline events. This is the key written after the "%%" signs to open an inline event block.
description.dateFormatFlowOnboarding: For this plugin to work it needs to be fed a couple of informations regarding dates and how to sort them.Right now token priority is as follow {dateParserGroupPriority} and output is formated using {dateDisplayFormat}. To customize this you can either use the more user friendly flow by pressing start or just edit the values yourself by hand. Worst case scenario you can also reset to default in the advanced section.
description.dateParserGroupPriority: No spaces and make sure to separate every entry with a ",". This value is used to order the parsed tokens. For example if your custom regex pulls the year month and day out of a date, the natural order should be "year,month,day". Note that you should have as many entries as your regex has capture groups. See presets for inspiration.
description.dateParserRegex: The regex used to parse your date. It needs to include the same amount of capture group as the next setting input. If you're unfamilliar with regexes and / or capture groups I would recommend to stick to the preset.
description.fantasyCalendarPresetKeys: This will preset all relevant keys in the settings to watch fantasy calendar uses. Namely the title override, the start date and end date keys
description.metadataKeyEventBodyOverride: The key for the body override in each notes metadata
description.metadataKeyEventTimelineTag: The key looked for when assigning timelines to an event
description.metadataKeyEventEndDate: The key that determines the end of an event in a note
description.metadataKeyEventPictureOverride: The key for the image override in each notes metadata
description.metadataKeyEventStartDate: The key that determines the start of an event in a note
description.metadataKeyEventTitleOverride: The key for the title override in each notes metadata
description.markdownBlockTagsToFindSeparator: The character or string used to split the different tags to find in a markdown code block. The split values will be looked for in notes.
description.tryYourInputFormat: Just type out the date like you would in a notes metadata block. Bellow, every field should corespond to the correct token and be sorted in the correct order.
description.lookForTagsForTimeline: This means if you tag you note with a string and include that string in the timeline definition this note will be included in the timeline computing
description.lookForInlineEventsInNotes: Check {linkText} on how to create inline events.
description.applyAdditonalConditionFormatting: Toggle on to allow date tokens conditional formatting to be allowed. When set to false this feature will be skipped. This could save you a few milliseconds off every card render.
description.stylizeDateInline: Turn on for a more compact display in your timeline event cards. Or turn off for more space.

configureSingleDateToken.STRING: A string typed date token represents something akin to our months. tl;dr, they are written using letter and not numbers
configureSingleDateToken.NUMBER: A numerical typed date token is your stardard number representing a date. Just make sure to configure it's mininal lengh. For example a minimal length set to 2 will result in the 6th day being written as "06"

configureSingleDateTokenType.minLength: If set to 2, this would always display at least two digit. So for a value of 3 it would display 03.
configureSingleDateTokenType.hideSign: When checked, the sign of the number won't be displayed on the card.

configureSingleDateTokenConditionalForma.conditionsAreExclusive: When checked only one condition need to be true for the format to apply. If it's unchecked all conditions need to be true.
configureSingleDateTokenConditionalForma.format: Use `{value}` to include the formated token in the template.

description.fantasyCalendarSpanEvents: Allow the plugin to look for span events inside the notes, this have a performance impact but furthers the compatibility with fantasy calendar

details.createDateToken: Write your date system tokens ordered from top to bottom. Make sure not to leave any cluter, these token will be used to capture your date and sort them in the expeted order.

text.tokenMismatchList: The previous list contains tokens that can't be found in your date token configuration, use the button bellow to update the token list and configure it properly once synced.

button.syncTokens: Update tokens to reflect the above configuration

placeholder.stringTokenDctionaryEntry: Type the desired output of the token...
